conclusion: Analyze the graph of the reciprocal of the velocity as a function of displacement to determine acceleration or deceleration.
The graph shows a straight line with points A and B marked, and reciprocal velocity on the y-axis and displacement on the x-axis.
The slope of the line in the graph represents the acceleration of the particle.
Slope is calculated as change in reciprocal velocity divided by change in displacement.
Calculate slope using values from the graph: slope = (1/0.5 - 1/1) / (0.5 - 1) = -2.
Negative slope indicates the particle is decelerating.
